property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={150, 23, 1068, 653}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value:
Instantiate a WebSocketServer, open a browser tab and send a series of numbers to a browser WebSocketClient.
The client may also be run independently.

property.name: text
property.value: Currently, the file is hardcoded as a constant in HTMLGraph. Alternatives are: Use a Ptolemy FileReader (not compatible with code gen) Use a REST accessor to fetch the content from terraswarm.org (unfortunately, introduces extra page formatting) Use a REST accessor to fetch from local host (the browser accessor would need to start the server in initialize()).

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval between outputs in milliseconds.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor starts a server that listens for web socket connection requests on the specified hostInterface and port. The hostInterface is needed only if the host machine has more than one network interface (e.g. Ethernet and WiFi) and 'localhost' does not resolve to the desired interface.

The output connection reports the when a connection is opened or closed.

When a message arrives on a connection, a received output is produced with that message. Note that the message may arrive in multiple frames, but it will be produced as a single message.

When an input arrives on toSend, then a message is sent to one or all of the open socket connections.

When wrapup() is invoked, this accessor closes the server and all connections.

The default type for both sending and receiving is 'application/json', which allows sending and receiving anything that has a string representation in JSON. The types supported by this implementation include at least:

  • application/json: The this.send() function uses JSON.stringify() and sends the result with a UTF-8 encoding. An incoming byte stream will be parsed as JSON, and if the parsing fails, will be provided as a string interpretation of the byte stream.
  • text/*: Any text type is sent as a string encoded in UTF-8.

  • image/x: Where x is one of json, png, gif, and more. In this case, the data passed to this.send() is assumed to be an image, as encoded on the host, and the image will be encoded as a byte stream in the specified format before sending. A received byte stream will be decoded as an image, if possible.

    This accessor requires the module webSocket.

property.name: author
property.value: Hokeun Kim, Edward Lee

property.name: hostInterface (parameter)
property.value: The IP address or domain name of the network interface to listen to.

property.name: port (parameter)
property.value: The port to listen to for connections.

property.name: pfxKeyCertPassword (parameter)
property.value: If sslTls is set to true, then this option needs to specify the password for the pfx key-cert file specified by pfxKeyCertPath.

property.name: pfxKeyCertPath (parameter)
property.value: If sslTls is set to true, then this option needs to specify the fully qualified filename for the file that stores the private key and certificate that this server will use to identify itself. This path can be any of those understood by the Ptolemy host, e.g. paths beginning with $CLASSPATH/.

property.name: receiveType (parameter)
property.value: The MIME type for incoming messages, which defaults to 'application/json'.

property.name: sendType (parameter)
property.value: The MIME type for outgoing messages, which defaults to 'application/json'.

property.name: sslTls (parameter)
property.value: Whether SSL/TLS is enabled. This defaults to false.

property.name: toSend (port)
property.value: The data to be sent to open sockets. If this is an object with 'socketID' field and a 'message' field, then send the value of the message field to the socket identified by the socketID field. If the input has any other form, then the message is broadcast to all open socket connections.

property.name: received (port)
property.value: A message received a client in the form of an object with two fields, a 'socketID', which is a unique ID for this client connection, and a 'message' field, which is the message received from the client.

property.name: listening (port)
property.value: When the server is listening for connections, this output will produce the port number that the server is listening on

property.name: connection (port)
property.value: An output produced when a connection opens or closes. The output is an object with two fields, a 'socketID', which is a unique ID for this client connection, and a 'status' field, which is the string 'open' or 'closed'.

property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: author

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks and Edward A. Lee. Based on TestSpontaneous by Edward A. Lee

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval before the output in milliseconds.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: The output port

property.name: delay (parameter)
property.value: The delay in milliseconds before the value is outputk.

property.name: value (parameter)
property.value: The value to be output after the delay.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Accessor that connects with a browser on the local host. This is intended to be used by a swarmlet to interact with users, for example by providing forms to be filled in. For now, however, it simply displays HTML provided to its input.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee (eal@eecs.berkeley.edu)

property.name: html (port)
property.value: An HTML document to render in the browser.

property.name: resources (port)
property.value: An object where each named property is an object containing two properties, 'data' and 'contentType'. The name of the named property is the path to be used to access the resource. The 'data' property is the resource itself, an arbitrary collection of bytes. The 'contentType' is the MIME type of the data.
